reviews.sentence: A little disappointed but staff made it right. Initially we were a little disappointed with our stay at this property. There was major construction remodeling going on beneath our room for the entirety of our stay. No one informed us of this upon our reservation or check in so we were surprised to discover the loud noise each morning. When I mentioned this to the front desk upon check out I was told a front desk supervisor would contact us. They did and she did make our stay right. However my biggest issue with the property is the lack of control each room has over heat or ac. This is all dictated by the hotel as it is an older property. I would not consider a return to this property until this has been updated. Each night is was very hot in our room and we had no way to adjust to a cooler temperature except for opening a window. This should be updated by corporate asap to compete in an area where there are a lot of hotel choices.

BEWARE OF CONSTRUCTION. ASK WHEN BOOKING. Normally a desirable place to stay. Recommended by friends but without any advance notice when booking through Hotelscom we found demolition and reconstruction taking place. NIGHTMARE in daytime. CONTINUAL JACKHAMERING FROM 9 AM TO 6 PM. absolutely no rest possible for my husband who has stage 4 terminal cancer and needed his rest. After pleading with the night manager he did leave instructions for a complimentary night after remodel is finished. but we had no rest during the day and checked out early as possible the next day.

Good. Part of the hotel was under renovation but it was not bothersome at all. Plus they made up for it by having free drinks snacks at happy hour everynight which was extra nice. Being on vacation with free drinks and full breakfast bar is the best. The staff were all nice and helpful. there is lots of shopping and dining near. I would definitely stay there again.

The right way to remodel. I have never stayed at this property before this trip so i do not know what it was like before. I do know it was recently remodeled and they did a excellent job. I have stayed at many remodeled and even brand new embassy suites were they got it wrong and it painfully obvious to the traveler. The hotel is clean and the staff is great. The breakfast line flows well and the reception is also on par.

My four day layover. Stayed four nights at Hilton Embassy Suits. The hotel is in Downey LA. There is a big mall and many restaurants nearby. The rooms are tired and need to be refurbished. The lobby has been recently renovated breakfast finishes at 9 too early if you are yet lag or vacationing. Staff is friendly but not very helpful.

Needs Remodeling. Excelente breakfast hotel staff. But in desperate need of remodeling. The air conditioning system did not work properly. There was a problem with the ac duct going to the bedroom are that maintenance could not fix did some minor repair. The TV system is outdated including the tvs it self. Rugs in the hallways were wrinkle furniture seems old. Bed and pilowse were comfortable and housekeeping did a great job keeping the room neat and clean.

Made my family sleep on the floor. This was one of the few hotels that can accommodate a family of 6 4 adults 2 kids in LA so I was really happy to have found a deal here. However after a long drive from San Francisco to LA I arrived at 11 pm only to find that they gave our suite away claiming that they do not honor third party reservations and it was my fault because I did not book with Embassy Suites directly. They said our only option was to sleep in a King suite room with one king bed and one sofa bed and they will give us blankets so the other two in our party can sleep on the floor. We were tired and upset and after we raised our concerns and annoyance the manager finally pulled the representative aside for five minutes. He came back to tell us that they have one two queen one sofabed suite that was under repair but it had a loud elevator noise that might disturb us. We reluctantly agreed not knowing how bad the noise was until we stepped into the room. The floor of the hotel suite was shaking every minute due to the elevator MOTOR not the elevator itself being located right next to our wall. The noise was unbearably loud I am not sure how they think they can sell someone a room like this. and we had enough of all the running around and went with the king suite. After all that and settling into our king suite and trying to situate ourselves we had to call the front office 5 times for them to send us additional blankets pillows and sheets so 2 in our party could sleep on the floor. The lady that kept delivering our sheets did not understand any english and kept delivering mattress pads and thin sheets no blankets. We eventually gave up around 1 am and made due with what we were given due to our early morning the next day. The next morning when we were getting ready we asked for extra towels and were handed bathroom floor rugs instead. Eventually we were given towels an hour after we initially requested them as we were getting ready to check out. The only silver lining to this monstrous rain cloud was their excellent breakfast. Great omelettes nice selection of foods and drink and the workers were very friendly unlike their front desk representatives. Tldr. because I booked through a third party Embassy sold my room to someone else and then did not give us appropriate alternative accommodations afterwards leading to two in my party to sleep on the floors and playing telephone to receive enough floor bedding blankets padding and towels. Zero customer service. The blame was placed on the customer at the end of the day because I did not book directly with them.

Warning for you all. Our experience was horrible. Even after being a Hilton honors member we were denied free wifi. We were 5 people staying at the hotel for 5 days and the management did not have the courtesy to give us such basic benefits. The upkeep of the hotel is also very sad. The receptionist who checked us in were very rude and unfriendly. The only good thing was the breakfast which was fresh and couple of choices.
I liked the proximity to attractions. I disliked the fact the hotel was going through renovations during my visit.

I love it here now even more they just finished remodeling the rooms and they r much more roomier and modern great look And. of course u can not miss out on the complimentary breakfast bar and free happy hour that is all included.
great staff and the remodel is gorgeous.

fabulous hotel with gorgous roomss. this hotel has been renovated and the rooms are gorgeousthe lobby is very beautifulthe rooms 2 room suite. are really gorgeous with lots of space and furniture in the right placesthe bed was very comfortable and very cleanthe breakfast area was great. breakfast to order and plenty of space to sitno problem with parkingdefinitely a place to stay when in that area.

Beautifully renovated amazing staff. My family of 6 stayed for 3 nights. We got in very late on the first night and were greeted by a very friendly front desk employee. Every single member of the hotel staff we came into contact with was super friendly and helpful. From the breakfast staff to the happy hour bartender to the housekeepers to the engineer who had our lights fixed within seconds of me calling the front desk the hair dryer tripped one of the fuse all were professional warm and seemed to really care that we were having a pleasant stay. My husband left his backpack in the back if a chair at happy hour and it was morning by the time he realized he ’d left it. He went down and the front desk had it safe and sound. All in all I only have positive things to say about our stay. The hotel has been recently renovated and is clean and beautiful too. The location is also great as we were able to walk to several restaurants and of course Porto ’s.

Very pleased. Updated rooms modern. Conveniently located. Front desk Staff were very courteous and accommodating. Ample parking well lit and security. Rooms were very clean with recent modern updates. Complimentary breakfast and reception are PERKS.
It just renovated it looks nice. The location is good.

Modern hotel central to all freeways. Beautiful renovations throughout the hotel. Rooms were spotless and quiet. Melissa at the front desk was exceptional. The pool area was quite dark and the water was cool.

Beautiful Suites. My boyfriend fell in love with this hotel because of the newly remodeled Suites. There s a living room area that is separate from the bedroom area. Depending on what side of the hotel you are on you will get a working balcony with a sliding door that lets you step outside or a view of view the city streets. it is a very cozy and cute Hotel. We prefer it over some other four star hotels that we have been to. He loves the communal area the water feature and the sitting area. I love the complimentary breakfast and the managers reception. Just if you go make sure you do not get a room next to the elevators or the air conditioning units because it could be noisy at night if you are a soft sleeper I do not think they could change that though. It sounds like an interesting view within the walls. Other than that if you have a room away from the elevators you will not hear that electrical sounds. it is pretty soundproof. we have never had an issue with noise.

This is the new and improved embassy. The the facelift came out beautiful and the staff are awesome. That girl is well Marvel bar not a grill but the people are very welcoming. The rooms are beautiful but the mattress well mine was a little bumpy. Maybe just this one we had two rooms and the others did not complain. I would definitely stay here again.

Our 9 night stay was horrible. Not sure how there are so many great reviews. You get no sleep with the events happening on the first floor almost every night. We were on the third floor and it was so loud we could hear everything. I took sleeping pills and I still could not sleep with all the noise. The lobby echoes a lot so we could hear everything from a man sneezing to children playing to peoples conversations. It was just awful when you want to go to sleep but hear people yelling and loud music all night. The pull out couch mattress is horrible and the mattress pad they give you to make it more comfortable did not even fit. The air conditioning never worked properly so the room was always hot. Each room has its own thermostat but after talking with the front desk they said that hot air is pushed in if it is cold outside or the majority or people want warm air so our room stayed uncomfortably warm the entire time. It was at least 20 degrees warmer in our room than the lobby and hallways. We could only sleep with a sheet and some nights with no sheet or blanket at all. I usually run cold so imagine other people who were with me. Also the air in the room is humid. Every time you walk into the hotel room you have to adjust to the hot moist air even from the day we checked in. The bathroom in the lobby smells so awfully mildewy that I hated using it but with only one bathroom and several people in the hotel room you have to. They falsely advertise free WiFi and made to order breakfast. There is no free WiFi you must pay daily or weekly despite the Google page and Expedia promising free WiFi. I even overheard a front desk employing telling someone over the phone the Information is outdated and they do not provide free WiFi. So the company is aware of the issue but just doing this to make more money. I know this woman was only answering the mans question but just pointing out it is not an oversight. There is no made to order breakfast like they claim. They will make you an omelette to order but otherwise it is a buffet with tasteless eggs and bacon watery oatmeal cold pancakes and no waffles. it is a huge buffet but the food was not very enjoyable. A few of the front desk employees were rude especially the guy who checked us in for just us asking questions or requesting some items. The positives of this hotel. It looks updated and is kept clean. The housekeeping and food buffet workers are really nice. You can tell they work hard and will help you with anything you need. Gustavo who works in the breakfast buffet was so nice and hardworking. Our entire family made sure to say goodbye to him before we checked out. He gets 55 stars. Unfortunately a hotel is supposed to be about comfort and it was not comforting or relaxing at all.
